subject: Re: [junit] junit with easymock
msgSnippet: hi, i did according to you.but its failure. ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
hi,

i did according to you.but its failure.

On Jan 4, 2008 3:42 PM, Lasse Koskela <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:

> Hi Pankaj,
>
>
> On Dec 19, 2007 6:15 AM, pankaj khare <pankaj.0405@...<pankaj.0405%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> > public void testTransfer()throws Exception
> > {
> > Account accountSender=new Account("1",200);
> > Account accountBeneficiary=new Account("2",100);
> > MockControl controlAccountManager=MockControl.createControl(
> > AccountManager.class);
> > AccountManager
> > mockAccountManager=(AccountManager)controlAccountManager.getMock();
> > mockAccountManager.findAccountForUser("1");
> > controlAccountManager.setReturnValue(accountSender );
> > controlAccountManager.replay();
> >
> > mockAccountManager.findAccountForUser(str2);
> > controlAccountManager.setReturnValue(accountBeneficiary );
> > controlAccountManager.replay();
> >
> > mockAccountManager.updateAccount(accountSender);
> > controlAccountManager.replay();
> > mockAccountManager.updateAccount(accountBeneficiary);
> > controlAccountManager.replay();
>
> Well, at least you're calling replay() multiple times on the same
> "controlAccountManager" object. That's not how it should be. You
> should only move your mock objects from recording mode to replay mode
> once:
>
> 1. record expectations for all mock objects
> 2. move to replay mode
> 3. invoke the code under test
> 4. verify the mock objects
>
> Lasse
>
> --
> Lasse Koskela
> * Author of "Test Driven" (Manning Publications, 2007) *
> * Reaktor Innovations * http://www.ri.fi/en *
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
